page.title: 13STOWEY CHURCH
page.content: Mentioned in the Domesday Book of 1086 as having 1 villager,1 smallholder and 1 plough, the village's population is now 80. There is a small and very beautiful church dedicated to St. Nicholas and St.Mary built in 1235 with local wool merchant's money. A pair of shears carved into the outside wall commemorates this gift and local prosperity.The Church contains many fine paintings by Lord Strachey depicting local villagers. There are 5 bells in the tower but they are no longer rung as the tower and bell platform are considered unsafe.The church is in need of much restoration and electrical re-wiring.The hard work and generosity of this small village raised Â£524 for church funds at a recent barbecue.
